title: Something I still don't understand about balance

replies.body:
What they are saying is that he is below average in terms of balance, but he is better in his losing situations when his cd's are up, so they are focussing on improving his weakness rather than improving his strength for the buffs that will bring him closer to balanced.

When people see a champ as "broken", that champ is really good at one thing and not so good at other things. That champ ends up being so good at that one thing that, even though they are winning a lot of encounters, they lose the game because the other team can outdo them elsewhere.

Ekko is good at skirmishes and roaming, but he isn't as good at objective control, teamfighting, or waveclear.
